title: Test Login Successful
manualSteps: 1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com/
2. Leave the Username field empty and click Login → verify error message “Epic sadface: Username is required” appears.
3. Refresh the page, enter a valid username (standard_user), leave Password empty, click Login → verify error message “Epic sadface: Password is required” appears.

4. Refresh the page, enter an invalid username (e.g. bad_user) and invalid password (e.g. wrongpass), click Login → verify error message “Epic sadface: Username and password do not match any user in this service” appears.
5. Refresh the page, enter a valid username and password but append a space at the end of each, click Login → verify same error message as step 4.
6. Refresh the page, enter a locked-out user (locked_out_user) and correct password (secret_sauce), click Login → verify error message “Epic sadface: Sorry, this user has been locked out.” appears.
7. Refresh the page, enter SQL injection string "admin' OR '1'='1" in Username and Password, click Login → verify generic error message appears and no redirect to inventory.html.
8. Refresh the page, enter 1000 ‘a’ characters in Username and Password, click Login → verify UI does not crash and appropriate error message is shown.
9. Refresh the page, open DevTools → Network → block the POST / endpoint, click Login → verify UI shows error message and no redirect.
10. Refresh the page, enter valid credentials, click Login, then immediately click browser back button → verify user is redirected back to login page and session is not kept.
11. Refresh the page, enter valid credentials, throttle network to 2G, click Login → verify loading state appears and after timeout error message is shown.
12. Refresh the page, enter valid credentials, double-click Login rapidly → verify only one request is sent and UI does not duplicate requests.

title: Test User Locked
manualSteps: Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com/
Wait until the login form is fully rendered
Locate the Username input field by its placeholder text 'Username'
Enter the exact text locked_out_user into the Username field
Locate the Password input field by its placeholder text 'Password'
Enter the exact text secret_sauce into the Password field
Locate the Login button
Click the Login button
Wait for the error container to appear
Assert that the error container is visible
Assert that the error text is exactly Epic sadface: Sorry, this user has been locked out.
Take a screenshot of the error for evidence (optional but recommended)
Mark the test as passed if all assertions are true
